headline: Incredibly Easy Chicken and Noodles
description: My aunt's chicken and noodles soup recipe is wonderfully rich thanks to two types of canned condensed soup. It's so simple and easy to make.

video.description: A simple, comforting, and easy recipe for chicken and noodles.
video.name: Incredibly Easy Chicken and Noodles

name: Incredibly Easy Chicken and Noodles
recipeIngredient: 1 (26 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup
1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup
2 cups diced, cooked chicken breast meat

recipeInstructions.text: Combine chicken broth, both condensed soups, and diced chicken in a large pot. Season with onion powder, seasoning salt, and garlic powder.
Bring to a boil over high heat and stir in noodles. Reduce heat to low and simmer until desired consistency is reached, 20 to 30 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Great I made huge batches and served with mashed potatoes and a dinner roll. Compliments all day. I cut back on the onion powder and added pepper. I will be making this regularly thanks!
I loved combining both of the soups & I changed it just a little. I put onions, celery, carrots & green peppers in mines, as well as Accent Salt.

I made this last night and it turned out amazing. I added more broth, broccoli, mushrooms and carrots. It was creamy and delicious. Next time I will put less noodles and more veggies bc we love extra vegetables. Definitely a keeper!!
Omg!!! My favorite plus super easy to make. My kids ask for this often and you can adjust it however you want.

As you can see, it‚Äôs still cooking so I haven‚Äôt tasted it yet. It looks amazing! I added a can of cream of celery and a bag of frozen carrots. I also added 1/4 tsp each of crushed peppercorn and black pepper. So far I‚Äôve used 48 oz of chicken broth and looks like I‚Äôll need more. Probably should have only used 1 bag of frozen noodles. üòÇ. I cheated with the chicken also and used the Tyson frozen precooked cubed chicken. I‚Äôm thinking about letting it cook for about 15 minutes and then dumping it into my crock pot to finish up slowly. I tasted the broth. The flavor and texture is awesome. I used about 64 oz of chicken broth, next time 1 bag of noodles!
Very good. I added more broth as my sauce was pretty thick. I used carrots, celery, onion and reames noodles. I hadn't made this in so long and so glad I made it! Great recipe!
So easy and so Good!
Added curry powder.
the only thing i changed was i sauted my chicken before adding it the recipe was easy and good as hell thanks
This is one of the best homemade soups I've had the privilege of making. The creamy texture is excellent and satisfying.
The only thing I did differently was use homemade pasta using a basic pasta recipe I found on here. My family loved it!
Very good! Fixed it for my wife and she loved it.

I found it FAR too rich. Further, the recipe said to use frozen egg noodles, which I did.

They ended up as a hard lump of noodles in the bottom of the pot.

I won't make it again.

I‚Äôve made this for 20 years and it‚Äôs a lovely and fun family base to play with. (Picky eaters? I sneak in cream of mushroom soup as I pur√©e the mushroom bits to nothingness. They never see the can labels You can play with consistency with lessening amount of broth (and always go low sodium condensed soups or they can taste too strong). Sometimes I add cheese to it so while not make and cheese has a yummy dimension you want seconds with good wide egg or shell pasta to hold nestle that chicken and wide egg noodle or shell pasta or spirals in. You need hearty noodles. A couple dashes of Worschershire to the soup mix also gives it a nice zing when not using. Soup mix as is great comfort food. Sometimes I pour it in casserole, too it with cheddar, buttered bread crumbs and bake til top is bubbly and browned. So versatile

Otto really liked this. Used 1 1/2 cups broth and one can cream of chicken soup, cut up cooked chicken . Cooked noodles separately and added at the end. Used poultry seasoning and sage. Garlic, onion powder and pepper. 
Next time I‚Äôll add celery, carrots and maybe peas.

This was excellent. Even better the next day. Although I did change it up a bit. Started by softening some onion, carrots and celery in butter. Then added the broth and seasonings. Let that come to a boil. Then I added wide egg noodles instead of the frozen, reduced the heat and let them soften and soak up the broth. While that was working I browned the chicken breasts in olive oil, seasoning them with a little salt, pepper and garlic powder. Once the noodles had soaked up most of the broth I added the creamed soups. And finally added the browned chicken breasts cut up bite sized. Stirred it all up and let it simmer for another 10 minutes.
I didn‚Äôt care for the flavor and the frozen noodles were tough.

Simple and the best chicken noodle recipe I've tried. Since there is only two to eat it I did cut back on the ingredients. I used 1 small can of creme of chicken soup, 2 cans of chicken broth, one round can of chicken breast and only half the amount noodles but not frozen. I warmed some peas in the microwave and mixed them in. It still makes quite a bit but it keeps well in the fridge.
This was fantastic! I will make this again and again. My picky teenager loved it and he is very hard to impress.
I cut the recipe back to 4. Still enough left overs for 4 ! Good.

Amazing and easy! I substituted 2 tablespoons of corn starch for the cream of mushroom soup. I also doubled up on the seasonings, used dried noodles, and a bag of frozen mixed vegetables. Will definitely be adding this to our regular rotation!
It was so delicious. & easy ! That was a key for me. I have added to my favorite recipes.
Loved it. So easy and delicious.
Delicious! I added Amish egg noodles and extra seasoning... excellent!

Yum! This stuff is very addictive. Like some others I used dried egg noodles and also took the lazy way out with some Perdue bagged chicken strips that I diced up. Still scrumptious. I think it‚Äôs too good (and easy) as is to get fancy with it, but I do think I‚Äôll substitute low sodium soups next time as it was just a tad salty. But that didn‚Äôt step me from scarfing down several helpings. Thanks so much!
This recipe was the perfect base! I added my own additional seasonings, celery, onion, green peppers, and a little white wine vinegar. Man! So delicious!
I followed the directions exactly. This was incredible! Very easy to make and absolutely delicious!
Amazing and delicious recipe. I won‚Äôt be going back to how I used to make chicken and noodles after this.
Delicious!
Made this one more times than I can count. This one is in my recipe book that gets used by me and my children.
The only change I made was added a little poultry seasoning.
Yum, this was very good...

So good. I added kale. I added 1/2 pound of sausage instead of chicken. I really enjoyed it and my kids (5 and 8) had multiple helpings. I also added some pepper, saut√©ed onions, and a little bit of Italian Seasoning. It was easy and tasty. I will definitely make it again.
I let this summer for about 3 hours, stirring often.

Really easy to make. I used 98% fat free cream of chicken and cream of celery (instead of mushroom) along with no salt added chicken broth. I also used Amish noodles and they cooked nicely (I let it simmer for 1 hour). I felt it needed something else, so I used pepper and that really helped. Thanks for sharing.
I absolutely loved making this recipe!!! It came out perfect, great flavor creamy. It was exactly what it was supposed to be!!! We loved it!
I followed this recipe and used homemade egg noodles instead of frozen. Everyone loved it!

Soo good. I prepared a bag of Amish style noodles separately for about 10 minutes then added to the chicken mixture for the last 10 minutes of cooking. Also added some chopped carrots when there was about 6 minutes left to cook. I‚Äôll add some celery too next time I think. Came out just how I wanted. Thanks.

Definitely a win in my book! I‚Äôve made it multiple times, using different leftover meats we‚Äôve had on hand‚Äîchicken, steak tips, a roast. And they‚Äôve all came out super good. I would absolutely recommend this recipe!
I cooked in crockpot on low for six hours starting with frozen chicken breasts and throwing everything else except the noodles in. I only did one can of chicken broth
Loved it! And I hate to cook!!

I wanted to see chicken soup recipe and not several cans of store bought canned souped used in a so-called recipe. You're right. Chicken soup is easy to make. You don't need to buy canned soup to make chicken soup.

I am in love with this recipe! It is a quick one pot recipe and tasted amazing and could not be simpler. I am not good with making homemade noodles there for I used Reames noodles in the frozen section which are pretty close to home made. This was my first time making homemade chicken and noodles and it came out fabulous!

I didn't have frozen noodles, so I just used a bag of dry egg noodles and cooked it before adding to the broth/sauce. I also added a pinch of poultry seasoning to give it some more flavor. This was a great way to use up left over rotisserie chicken and was family and kid approved.

Such a great recipe! I wanted to have some veggies in mine tho so I saute together several carrots and celery stalks, diced, with diced onion. I didnt have seasoned salt so I added salt, pepper, celery seed and paprika and a teaspoon of Knorr chicken boullion to improvise. I could only find the noodles in 24 oz bags so I went with that and added a little more chicken broth. Whether I made changes or not this recipe is very good, if you want to add some veggies to it or personalize it more the recipe as a base is easy to work with.

I needed something quick to take to a friend who just got out of the hospital. I made it and I was skeptical that it would taste decent I had my husband and daughter try it and they loved it. Not sure why it was so good, but I didn‚Äôt want to ask too many questions. I used canned cubed chicken for ease. I think next time I might put some carrots and celery in it just for color and texture but it definitely was not needed this time around.
Simple, tasty, soothing. Highly recommend this simple meal.

I made this for the first time today because my family is getting over some 12 hour bug. This totally got the spot! Only difference I did was add 32 oz of chicken broth. I will definitely be using this recipe from here on out.
this was really easy. I only had one can of cream of chicken, so I added 8 oz half & half and some additional chicken base. also used the wide seen noodles that I had. minor mods, worked well.
Great! We‚Äôre not a fan of mushrooms so I used two cans of cream of chicken used less salt. My boyfriend loves it!

I loved this recipe, I was looking for something extra for my chicken & noodles so I did so with the cream of mushroom soup. I used 2 cans & added carrots & celery, parsley, and other seasonings to my taste. So from now on cream of mushroom soup is my secret ingredient, thank you...Dannigirl
So easy to make and delicious! Great for those cold winter nights.

Made exactly as directed, except my box of broth was 44 oz (4 ounces more than called for) and my frozen noodles came in a 24 oz package (6 oz more than called for). DELICIOUS and crazy simple! Be sure to grind some fresh pepper over it!

Great base for old school, southern style comfort food. I did realize I only had low sodium soups and broth so I substituted garlic salt for garlic powder and added celery salt, per another reviewer's suggestion. I also boiled, then shredded the chicken, threw in minced onions, finely chopped baby spinach, defrosted frozen peas and corn, and about 10 sliced white mushrooms. At the last minute, and at the suggestion of another review, I added about 2 TB of butter a few minutes before serving, which made a huge difference in richness for the little that was incorporated into the gravy. I served it with Grands southern-style biscuits. My husband said it tasted like pot pie and I thought it was similar to my Granny's chicken and dumplings. So awesome! Next time I will add fresh carrots for nutrients, color, and a little extra sweetness.

The key to mouthwatering chicken and noodles is to cook chicken thighs overnight in a crock pot to extract the best flavors from the fat and bones into the broth. I make homemade egg noodles with mine. Takes a little longer but this dish is a favorite everytime I serve it. This is comfort food at it's finest. Not meant to be bold flavored. It makes my mouth happy.

This is such a versatile base. As is its simple fare but homey and good for cold nights. I did par cook Reams noodles for ten mins than added them to the pot. I also used fresh onions and garlic. You can literally use any veggie left in your fridge. Tweak as needed and add the salt last. I served it with a salad and multigrain bread. If you want a thinner sauce or more of it at the end add in more ckn broth, sour cream or even milk.

My family LOVES this recipe. I tried for years to make chicken and noodles as good as my mother's. Although I still think that my mother's chicken and noodles tastes better, (The recipe for her chicken and noodles is in her head!) I think it makes a close 2nd and my family, (who has never tasted my mother's chicken and noodles) thinks it comes in first!
This was super tasty. We swapped the frozen noodles with bagged boiled noodles. We served with cheesy biscuits . Great.
This is amazing! I sauteed 3 diced chicken breasts in butter and added to the mixture. Thank you for sharing this.
Good recipe. I did use some chopped carrots and celery as a personal choice and to stretch it since there are 2 of us, OI made a half recipe.
Easy, creamy, and chunky, just the way I like it! I added frozen corn, carrots, and green beans to get that nutrition.
I doubled the recipe and added carrots, onions and celery. The whole family loved it.
My boyfriends favorite I add a lot of pepper and make my own stock. Other than that amazingly yummy!!!
I made this recipe last night. Everyone loved it. I used a rotisserie chicken ( I was to lazy to cook my own) it was amazing!

Added canned corn & mushrooms; steamed a small bag of carrots; totally spontaneous in the actual measurement of ingredients. A delicious meal and so grateful for such a quick and easy out of the can recipe for chicken and noodles.
Great. Used VERY al dente noodles.
ONE serving is more than 1 and a half times your DAILY sodium. It's an easy recipe, but this is insane!

I made it with 2 cans of cream of chicken instead of 1 chicken and 1 mushroom (just not a mushroom fan) and doubled the spices. It may have been because of the soup change, but when I tasted it halfway through it reaaaally needed more seasoning. But with those simple changes it was perfect for us! Bonus points for how well it heats up; my husband never does leftovers, but with these he actually ate leftovers TWICE. Really simple but really delicious.

My family requests this dish regularly and there‚Äôs always enough to freeze a few servings for later. It is delicious as is, but here are the changes I‚Äôve made to suit us: I use homemade chicken bone broth for increased nutrition and because it‚Äôs so inexpensive and simple to make and freeze. I substitute 3 regular size cans of cream of chicken soup for the large one and I buy the frozen noodles that are already cooked to make this easy recipe come together even faster. I add 2 bags of frozen peas & carrots for added color and nutrition as well, steamed in the microwave. Today I tried making in the crockpot and it turned out beautifully. I actually put the chicken and broth in frozen on high. When the meat was 165 degrees (a couple hours) I shredded it and whisked in the cream soups and seasonings, and let it heat up for another hour or so. Then added the veggies & frozen noodles. Another hour and it was done and ready to eat. Next time I‚Äôm going to try adding a few Tbsp of butter just because it sounds good. Thanks for sharing a great recipe!
no and yes

The basic recipe is good by itself but I threw in some carrots, celery and onion. Got a Ninja Foodi last year so pressure cooked the chicken which made it very easy! Thank you for sharing. It‚Äôs delicious!!
Easy, quick and tasty recipe. I used fresh boiled chicken then diced, and saved the broth using it instead of the store bought broth. I also added some frozen peas and carrots. Will make again.
Came out great! Made about half, and used Montreal chicken seasoning since I didn‚Äôt have onion or garlic powder, and leftover rotisserie chicken. Picky kid liked it!
I added some sauteed onions, carrots and mushrooms to round it out a little and was very good. My 2 year old granddaughter ate it right up, declaring "mmmmm, dewicious, thank you Grandma"
was easy and filling. leftovers were better the next day!
Good. I added carrots and celery to make it more like soup.
Delicious, I didn‚Äôt have cream of chicken so added 2 cans of cream of mushroom, came out perfect. Will make again
No changes - it was excellent - will make again for sure.
Delicious! I added frozen carrots.
Comfort food!
Great recipe! I tweaked it a little by adding sauteed chopped carrots, celery and onion .
It is good I did add some veggies though.
Super easy and delicious! Overnight they got a little thick so I added some milk while reheating and they were even better after! Will definitely be making again
Delicious! Only change I made was I didn‚Äôt use frozen noodles

I love this recipe it's the same one my mom uses the only thing I do differently is use cream of chicken only also I cook mine in the crockpot so I can just set it and forget it but this recipe is definitely the way to go, it's comes out delicious every time
Added cream of onion soup
I made this it is really good. I think I am going to make with homemade egg noodles next time and see how it turns out.
Quick and tasty. Definitely use low sodium soups!

I used cooked egg noodles and added heated peas and corn. I only needed to heat it after adding the noodles and vegetables for 15 minutes instead of 30. It was very tasty and even my picky family loved it.

Tasted good. I added a little more seasoning than what it called for and I would add a little more broth but I didn‚Äôt have enough. It‚Äôs nice and thick as well. Added peas and more mushrooms. Tasted great!!

I didn't have the condensed chicken soup so I solely used all mushroom soup. I cooked all the ingredients till it was the consistency I wanted. Also, for flavor, I sliced up half an onion and used real garlic. As suggested, heavy on the pepper. Once the stock was done I added carrots and a piece of left over turkey sausage. LOL I cooked regular egg noodles on the side for 7 minutes then added noodles to stock. Let it boil back up for 5 minutes. Mine was thick but not too thick and not too soupy. Great tasting chicken and noodles!

I use these modifications for all my chicken "soup" style meals. Look around for CREAM OF CHICKEN W/HERB it takes the flavor up a notch. I used cream of celery instead of the mushroom (husband is weird) and I added a LARGE chicken bullion cube (2 small). I used medium flat egg noodles cookes for 20 min in the sauce (husband had 2 bowls, I am working on my second and there won't be any left overs by the end of day tomorrow.
This is definitely going into our winter rotation! Absolutely delicious! Definitely use the frozen homestyle egg noodles ‚Äî they really make a difference.

My husband and daughters loved this easy and simple soup. I used the low sodium versions of condensed soups. Next time I‚Äôll make it with my recently homemade condensed cream of soups. Also thinking of throwing in some frozen veggies to make it heartier.

I didn't have all the right ingredients on hand so I had to improvise a little, but it turned out amazing! I used 2 cans cream of mushroom soup, a jar of chicken gravy, and dried egg noodles but other than a little less cooking time for the pasta I followed the recipe. Added some canned corn and peas at the end too. Family loved it!
simple but was very good.
Super easy and tasted amazing! I just didn‚Äôt use the mushroom soup because everyone knows how picky a 5 year old can be!
Followed directions, except used regular dried noodles, it was just a bit salty, but everyone loved it a lot. We also kept the veg out of it and mixed it in at the end,
My first ever attempt to make chicken and noodles and I nailed it with this recipe. The whole family loved it and can't wait for more. Thanks!
